title: fried rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add diced vegetables and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and pour the beaten eggs on the other side. Scramble until fully cooked.
Add the cooked rice and stir to combine with the vegetables and eggs.
Stir in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until heated through and evenly mixed.
Serve hot.

title: salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, croutons and shredded cheese (if using).
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss until everything is evenly coated.
Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

title: cornflakes
ingredients: Fresh fruit (such as berries, banana, or mango), for topping (optional)
instructions: In a large bowl, pour the cornflakes and add the milk.
Stir in the sugar (if using) until dissolved.
Serve the cornflakes in bowls and top with fresh fruit (if using).
Enjoy immediately.

title: oats
ingredients: Fresh fruit (such as berries, banana, or apple), for topping (optional)
Nuts (such as almonds or pecans), for topping (optional)
Honey or maple syrup, for drizzling (optional)
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the oats, milk, water, sugar (if using), cinnamon (if using), and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the oats are soft and the mixture is creamy, about 5-7 minutes.
Serve the oats in bowls and top with fresh fruit, nuts (if using), and a drizzle of honey or maple syrup (if using).
Enjoy immediately.
